text: Reminder: Hey all, if you’d love to hang with other developers attending INBOUND virtually, join us in <#C01BBPNJ25A|inbound-conference>.
Have you tried staging a cloned page, then push your "dev" theme and select it, when you're confident, edit the links to the files and push them to your regular theme folder?

It's kind of having like two themes and interchange between them according to the changes, so one theme is always your staging theme and the other is the live one, this can work hand in hand with your local workflow if you have two branches...
No haven’t tried this, i’ve seen the staging section of HS only once. Do you have any doc on this? or is it just: trail and error till you get it right? thanks for this tho!

I don't have a particular doc on this, my approach is having a test account for each project (thus i loose the live data/pages/etc...) but I guess it would work like having two themes on your account. <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/redesign-and-relaunch-your-site-with-content-staging|here is some info on content staging>
just a fast question: im looking for info in the cms pricing page but i cant see if the starter have hubdb, somebody knows?
CMS Starter does not have HubDB access.
HubDB starts at CMS Hub Professional

I'm not sure right now but, here is a use case:

Imagine you have to notify a customer to subscribes to the service by completing the payment via the <https://www.linkedin.com/feed/#|HubSpot> payments feature.

Now, the customer changed their mind and wanted to subscribe to another plan of that same service, and they replied accordingly to the seller. Instead of sharing the payment link manually again, Sellers can automate the task to share the pricing link with HubSpot Workflows + HubSpot Payment and receive the payments in HubSpot.
This automation could get easily implemented as per the buyer's real-time response.

*`I wonder if HubSpot provides a way to track the Abandoned payments (If a customer clicked on the payment link but didn't complete the payment). Based on the same scenario, sellers can automate the mails via HubSpot workflow to target & retain the customer.`*

<https://www.linkedin.com/feed/#|HubSpot> payments + Workflows
